## References






Szot, M., Frączek, B., & Tyrała, F. (2022). Nutrition Patterns of Polish Esports Players. MDPI Open Access Journals, 15(1), 149. https://doi.org/10.3390/nu15010149 

Dietary habits of Polish esports players were analyzed using principle component analysis. It is known that nutrition can affect performance, so the researchers wanted to find common dietary trends. It was found that gaming over time is correlated with poor dietary habits.


Uddin, N. et. al. (2019). Mapping of climate vulnerability of the coastal region of Bangladesh using principal component analysis. ScienceDirect, 102, 47-57. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.apgeog.2018.12.011 

In a study of the causes of climate change in Bangladesh, principle component analysis was used to reduce a list of 31 indicators to 7, which were Demographic Vulnerability, Economic Vulnerability, Agricultural Vulnerability, Water Vulnerability, Health Vulnerability, Climate Vulnerability, and Infrastructural Vulnerability.  




Naseem S., Mohsin M., Hui W., Liyan G., & Penglai K. (2021). The Investor Psychology and Stock Market Behavior During the Initial Era of COVID-19: A Study of China, Japan, and the United States. Frontiers, 12. https://doi.org/10.3389/fpsyg.2021.626934

Researchers analyze stock market data using principle component analysis. The researchers found that investors invested less money in the stock market when they were concerned about Covid-19.
